WebVR app using A-Frame 1.7.1. draw a hexagon.
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Certainly! Below is a complete HTML file that implements a WebVR app using A-Frame 1.7.1 to draw a hexagon. The A-Frame framework allows for easy creation of VR experiences in a web browser.

You can copy and paste the following code into an HTML file and open it in a web browser that supports WebVR (like Chrome with the appropriate flags enabled).

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Hexagon in WebVR</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.7.1/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body {
            margin: 0;
            overflow: hidden;
        }
        a-scene {
            position: absolute;
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>

<a-scene>
    <!-- Define a hexagonal shape using the A-Frame geometry -->
    <a-entity geometry="primitive: polyhedron; vertices: 6; radius: 1; operation: object; detail: 0;"
              material="color: #4CAF50; shader: flat"
              position="0 1 -5"
              rotation="0 0 0"
              scale="1 1 1">
    </a-entity>

    <!-- Camera -->
    <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>

    <!-- Light -->
    <a-entity light="type: directional; color: #FFF; intensity: 0.5" position="-1 2 1"></a-entity>
    <a-entity light="type: ambient; color: #FFF; intensity: 0.5"></a-entity>

    <!-- Ground -->
    <a-plane rotation="-90 0 0" width="10" height="10" color="#7BC8A4"></a-plane>
</a-scene>

</body>
</html>
```

### Explanation:
1. **A-Frame Library**: The A-Frame library is included by referencing the CDN link of version 1.7.1.
2. **Scene**: The `<a-scene>` element creates the 3D scene.
3. **Hexagon Shape**: A hexagon is created using `a-entity` with a `geometry` defined as a `polyhedron` specifying 6 vertices and a radius of 1.
4. **Camera**: The camera position is set to give a good view of the hexagon.
5. **Lighting**: There are two light sourcesâ€”one directional light and one ambient light to illuminate the scene.
6. **Ground Plane**: A ground plane is added for a reference point.

You can load this code by saving it as an HTML file (e.g., `hexagon.html`) and opening it in a compatible WebVR browser. Enjoy your VR experience!
